1953 Cadillac Convertible | Ardell Brown Classic Carswww.ardellscars.com/1953-cadillac-convertible/This Series 62 convertible has been treated to an extensive ground up restoration. The paint is near flawless and extensive restoration was done on the chrome trim and bright work. The interior has been re-stitched in original type pattern and features Cadillac amenities such as power windows, seat and convertible top. The 160 hp, 331 cu in overhead valve V-8 has been rebuilt and features the ultra rare Dynaflow transmission. Power steering and brakes are also options on this car. Other mechanical refurbishing includes recent front suspension alignment. This Cadillac is presented nicely with Kelsey-Hayes wire wheels and wide white wall tires.The 1953 Series 62 saw a redesigned grille with heavier integral bumper and bumper guards, the re positioning of parking lamps directly under the headlights, chrome "eybrow" type headlamp doors, and one piece rear windows without division bars. Wheel discs were fashioned in an attractive new disced design. Series 62 bodystyles were identified by non louvered rear fenders, the use of thin bright metal underscores on the bottom rear of the cars only and the decoration of both hood and deck lid with Cadillac crests and V- shaped ornaments.
CADILLAC: 1953 Fleetwood project car, convertible & hardtop, $10,000. Contact: 561-498-5600 or 561-436-3131, FL; www.europeanautobodyinc.com (278)
Pedigree Motorcars is proud offer this beautiful 1953 Cadillac Series 62 convertible. For details and information contact Ken Baker at 561-866-1601.

1953 is a hallmark year for Cadillac. It was a peak for Cadillac's styling and glamour. Many collectors and enthusiast believe 1953 models were the most beautiful of the 50s Cadillac's. This 1953 Series 62 captures the glamour, Style, and quality of Cadillac.

Having been restored over 15 years ago, this example has held up beautifully. Painted in exquisite Pastoral Blue, It has a light and dark blue leather interior, and is complemented with the dark blue convertible top.

This car was restored to the highest level and in its original colors. The paint on this car is absolutely magnificent and is free from any flaws. All of the chrome is stunning. It does not show any age whatsoever. The chrome is absolutely magnificent and is one of the key styling features of this beautiful car. All of the trim on the exterior is beautiful and fits exactly as it should. It is clearly evident that no expense was spared in this cars restoration. The convertible top is new and shows hardly any wear. As expected, the wheel covers are in the same condition as the rest of the car and it sits on the correct period white wall tires.
The engine bay in the car is show quality and shows tremendous attention to detail. The engine and it's compartment are as impressive as the exterior of the car.
Inside, the leather sheets show typical patina from any car that was driven, well cared for, and loved. As expected, there are no rips and tears just normal usage on the leather.

This Cadillac is a fantastic driver. Upon one twist of the key the massive V8 comes to life and is so smooth, you could barely feel or hear it running. In driving the car it makes smooth power and you barely feel the transmission shift. It's an absolute pleasure to take on an evening or Sunday cruise.
As with all of our cars, this Cadillac received a thorough inspection and service before we put it for sale. In getting the car ready for sale we performed:
Oil and filter change
Flush and refill hydraulics for power windows and power steering system
Adjust right front and rear windows
Perform wheel alignment
Repair exhaust system
Torque all oil pan bolts, front cover bolts, valve cover bolts
Replace flasher unit repair wiring to front indicators
Repair right front headlight bezel
Adjust drivers door handle
Change brake fluid

This Cadillac is now ready to be driven and enjoyed. We have been driving it and thoroughly enjoy every outing in it. This is the car that it's new owner can drive on special occasions or show and be proud of it anywhere it goes.
At Pedigree Motorcars we show cars by appointment only. Contact Ken Baker at 561-866-1601 to arrange your private showing of this beautiful 1953 Cadillac. Additional photos available upon request.
1953 Cadillac Fleetwood 60 Special,

This fine original Caddy is titled and insured in my name and I joyfully drive it on a regular basis. It has just over 60,000 original miles. I purchased this one from a local long time collector who is retiring to Florida. He was the third owner and had it in his collection for some 30 years. He's a cool guy, I will furnish his contact information to the buyer.

The body is in remarkable condition with virtually no rust. There is no rust in the frame and the floors and underpinnings are very good for a car this age. The doors open and close beautifully and all panels are FACTORY STRAIGHT. The finish looks show winning until you get up close. Portions of the paint appear to be original. The "Korean era" chrome is original and showing its age. The interior is all original with the exception of the rugs, and is still serviceable. I have many additional photos and video available upon request. I would rate this car as a good, mellow driver. If you want to hang with the "trophy set" this isn't the car for you.

The car needed very little to be put into reliable roadworthy condition; new brakes, radial tires, grease fittings and some carburetor work. The previous owner recently had the transmission rebuilt, and he also installed an electric fuel pump which I left in place. The car starts every time - hot or cold. The brake pedal is nice and high and the steering is smooth, and though the engine has low compression in one cylinder (about 60 lbs.), it still delivers good power and runs nicely. In spite of this, the old Cadillac is still a pleasure to drive, (on the highways the car does well in the left lane). The "Autronic Eye" has been disconnected and as a result only the high beams work (which I angled down slightly). The power windows and seat work nicely. The turn signals, horn and brake lights work fine, as do the dash, glove box, and courtesy lights. The heater is nice although the missing control valve has been by-passed. The radio lights up, but doesn't work. I may try to replace the vibrator (extra one included) if I have the time. The wipers are slow and need new blades. All locks are working fine with the correct keys. In short, this car is ready to enjoy now.

If you have owned many collector or antique vehicles this age, you know how troublesome a poorly done or misrepresented piece can be to drive and maintain. As is often the case, shoddy work done by ignorant or back yard mechanics can make a "restored" car a miserable experience to own. Disgusted owners sell them for a fraction of the money invested. That is not the case here. I don't think you'll find a sweeter old fishtail Cadillac anywhere for the money. Please see my satisfaction guarantee below and remember I have additional photos and supporting video. Please call me for further details at 973-366-5853 between 9:00AM and 9:00 PM. You can also check my reputation by looking at my feedback or by typing in "The Golden Gup" on any search window.

I'm a mobile DJ by trade but I love old Cadillacs! In my 45 years of driving, I've probably owned over a hundred of them. I'm a hobbyist, I like to buy them, fix 'em up, find them a new happy home, then go out and get another (at this point, I'd like to find a classic touring sedan or limo from the late 30's).
